title: How Can I Prevent Bladder Infections?
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: There’s no sure way to prevent a bladder infection . But some doctors suggest that it may help to do these things:
bullets: Avoid bubble baths, soaps, and powders that have perfumes in them. Also, avoid using feminine hygiene sprays or douches.
Don’t hold it in too long when you have to pee. Go to the bathroom when you feel the urge. And try to empty your bladder completely.

Drink plenty of liquids. Cranberry juice may be helpful in preventing a bladder infection, some studies show. It may keep bacteria from attaching to the bladder and creating an infection. Although the UTI benefits of drinking enough fluids aren’t certain, it probably wouldn’t hurt to try.
Pee before and after having sex. It is especially important for women to urinate after sex to flush out their urethras.
If you use a diaphragm or spermicide and often get bladder infections, talk to your doctor about other birth control options.
Wipe your bottom front to back after you go to the bathroom. This may help prevent bacteria around the anus from getting into the urethra and ultimately the bladder.
Wear cotton underwear and loose, nonbinding clothing that does not trap heat and moisture.

meta_description: There’s no sure way to prevent a bladder infection, but there are some things you can do you lower your risk. WebMD explains.
